alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 2:25PM PST until December 23 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Quick-hitting Period of Wet Snow will bring Tricky Travel Conditions to some Trinity County Mountain Passes above 3000 feet on Tuesday... ...Heavy Snowfall Expected Above 4000 feet in Trinity County Late Wednesday and Thursday... .The first in several rounds of precipitation expected to impact northwest California through the holiday weekend will arrive in Trinity County Tuesday. Snow levels will start around 2500 feet and rise to around 3500 feet Tuesday night. Most snow accumulations are now expected to be limited to elevations above 3000 feet, though some light snow may fall down to 2500 feet initially as the precipitation finally arrives Tuesday afternoon. Precipitation will taper off later Tuesday night. Snow levels are expected to be mainly above 4000 feet with the next round of heavier precipitation Wednesday into Thursday, before much colder air begins flowing in through the weekend. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 3000 feet, wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 4000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 12 inches possible. * WHERE...Northern Trinity County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM to 10 PM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult over some mountain passes along Highways 3, 36 and 299. Plan on slippery and potentially snow- covered roads, with possible chain restrictions over some passes. On Wednesday and Wednesday Night, travel over Scott Mountain Summit could be very difficult.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
